intro: Banara orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco banara, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a glossy surface, while its fruits are small, fleshy berries. Banara orinocensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and riverbanks.
